insights.name: Assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand
insights.description: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria in Sarajevo, which triggered the outbreak of World War I.

insights.name: Germany declares war on Russia
insights.description: Germany declares war on Russia, marking a significant escalation in the conflict that would become World War I.

insights.name: Germany declares war on France
insights.description: Germany declares war on France, further expanding the conflict of World War I.

insights.name: Germany invades Belgium
insights.description: Germany invades Belgium as part of the Schlieffen Plan, leading to British involvement in the war.

insights.name: United Kingdom declares war on Germany
insights.description: The United Kingdom declares war on Germany in response to the invasion of Belgium.

insights.name: First Battle of the Marne
insights.description: A significant battle where the Allies halted the German advance into France, marking a turning point in the war.

insights.name: Second Battle of Ypres
insights.description: The first major battle to use chemical weapons on the Western Front, marking a new phase in warfare.

insights.name: Battle of the Somme
insights.description: One of the largest battles of World War I, known for its high casualties and the introduction of the tank.

insights.name: Battle of the Somme ends
insights.description: The Battle of the Somme officially ends, with over a million men wounded or killed.

insights.name: United States enters World War I
insights.description: The United States declares war on Germany, joining the Allies in the conflict.

insights.name: German Spring Offensive
insights.description: A series of German attacks along the Western Front, aiming to achieve a decisive victory before American forces could arrive in full strength.

insights.name: Second Battle of the Marne
insights.description: The last major German offensive of World War I, which was ultimately repelled by the Allies.

insights.name: Meuse-Argonne Offensive
insights.description: The largest American military operation in World War I, contributing to the eventual defeat of Germany.

insights.name: Armistice of Compiègne
insights.description: The armistice signed between the Allies and Germany, marking the end of fighting in World War I.
